body:
Can you try v1.57.0 and also [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) please?

If you can reproduce with the beta, then please `kill -QUIT` the process when it gets stuck and post the backtrace - thanks!
Seems that operation is successful finish after 1 hour after 100% progress is shown. I don't know why takes too long to "close" connection.

I don't know what is happening either!

Can you run it again, and when it is in that 1 hour period then `kill -QUIT` the process when it gets stuck and post the backtrace - thanks!
I will do. When or where access backtrack ?
The backtrace will be printed to standard error so will appear in the terminal. If you set `--log-file` it will appear in there.
There's no error, just delay and waiting to finish. It takes 1 hour. I checked/looked after error but nothing
When it starts waiting, I'd like you to `kill -QUIT` the process, **then** look in the log.

I have what sounds like a similar issue. After copying files with rclone, things seem to get stuck -- the process reaches 100% and no further updates appear on screen except for the statistics updating (time increasing and average upload speed speed decreasing accordingly).

The command (called within a shell script):
```
rclone --progress --inplace --size-only --no-traverse -vv copy --transfers 20 --checkers 20 ./dist/ bunny:/
```

Here's the backtrace as requested:
https://gist.github.com/joshualyon/30532efb6262b09a1ebb50c4ce84fc88

And here's the version information:
```
rclone v1.64.0
- os/version: ubuntu 20.04 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 5.10.16.3-microsoft-standard-WSL2 (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.21.1
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none
```


**Edit**: For what it's worth, I suspect it could be something unique about WSL in my case. I haven't seen the issue occur directly in PowerShell (Windows) or ZSH (Mac).

Here is a processed version of the backtrace

I deleted the irrelevant stuff.

This looks like it is stuck listing the local directory. The local
directory listing appears to have just frozen for the last 3 minutes.
That is these processes

> 7: IO wait [3 minutes] [Created by march.(*March).processJob in goroutine 136 @ march.go:438]

So, yes, this looks very much like a WSL kernel bug to me.

```
1: semacquire [3 minutes]

    runtime    proc.go:404           goparkunlock(...)
    runtime    sema.go:160           semacquire1(#127, 0x20, 1, 0, 0x6b)

    march      march.go:213          (*March).Run(#50, {#12, #94})
    sync       sync.go:892           (*syncCopyMove).run(#132)
    sync       sync.go:1136          runSyncCopyMove({#11, #21}, {#15, #48}, {#14, #79}, 0, 0, 0xaf, 0)

7: IO wait [3 minutes] [Created by march.(*March).processJob in goroutine 136 @ march.go:438]

> This looks like it is stuck listing the local directory. The local directory listing appears to have just frozen for the last 3 minutes.

Thanks for the insights. 

It completed all the base actions with starting up the process, creating the backend, making the various connections, and processing each of the files (checking their sizes and uploading them if needed). 

I'm not intimately familiar with the inner workings of rclone, but I vaguely remember seeing that rclone then does another pass of checking all the files after the upload. Are you suggesting that this is where it got stuck listing the local directory (eg. on the second pass)?

---

For my needs, we'll just update our deployment script to run directly in Powershell. We originally were running it in WSL for Windows machines as our prior solution relied on `rsync`, but since `rclone` has native Windows support, we can write the script in an OS agnostic way again.

That being said, if there's anything I can do to help with further testing or troubleshooting -- assuming you would even want to try to work around this issue with WSL -- just let me know. :)

> This looks like it is stuck listing the local directory. The local directory listing appears to have just frozen for the last 3 minutes. That is these processes
> 
> > 7: IO wait [3 minutes] [Created by march.(*March).processJob in goroutine 136 @ march.go:438]
> 
> So, yes, this looks very much like a WSL kernel bug to me.

I looked at the stuck backtrace again, and I think I was wrong with my previous interpretation - apologies!

The traces are all listing directories, but they are stuck trying to make new SSH connections to the SFTP server. So maybe the SFTP server is ignoring connections because rclone has made to many or maybe there is a networking problem or something like that.

So I don't think this is a WSL problem directly unless it is interfering with the networking.

Thanks for the update. The last logged line was:

```
2023-09-28 12:31:37 DEBUG : sftp://REDACTED@storage.bunnycdn.com:22//: Closing 53 unused connections
Transferred:       11.303 MiB / 11.303 MiB, 100%, 16.056 KiB/s, ETA 0s
Checks:               278 / 278, 100%
Transferred:          206 / 206, 100%
Elapsed time:      3m38.1sSIGQUIT: quit
```

Is it possible that it was actually hung-up trying to *close* connections?

I don't think so according to the backtrace. The SFTP backend periodically closes unused connections.

53 is quite a lot of connections though more than I would expect for `--transfers 20 --checkers 20`. I'd expect 40 or (maybe a few more). This doesn't include the connections in use either which there are at least 20.

After a lot of investigation I discovered that `--no-traverse` can do `--checkers` * `--checkers` stat calls in parallel which is what is blowing up the number of connections. I fixed that to only do `--checkers` in parallel and the number of connections looks sensible now.

I think this will fix your issue as it will stop rclone overloading the server with too many connections to the point where it is rate limiting or refusing the connections.

Please give this a go!

[v1.65.0-beta.7426.b17151815.fix-5824-sftp-connections](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-5824-sftp-connections/v1.65.0-beta.7426.b17151815.fix-5824-sftp-connections/) on branch [fix-5824-sftp-connections](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-5824-sftp-connections) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

My apologies for the late reply. I was just reviewing GitHub notifications and found this unread message. I tried the 1.65.0-beta (5824 fix) and it does seem to create substantially fewer connections. **I only saw 20 created connections and 20 closed at the end and did not experience the aforementioned issue when running this in WSL.**

I'll switch back to the WSL deployment approach using this 1.65.0-beta (5824) version to give it some more 'burn-in' time with further deployments and let you know if I see any regressions. 

Regardless of if this was the underlying issues or a side-effect, it certainly seems like a positive improvement! 

---

The reason I have some hesitation is I've been using the native 1.64.0 Windows rclone binary with the same flags (`--transfers 20 --checkers 20`) and it is consistently creating a large number of connections –oftentimes closing upwards of 60+ connections by the end– but it doesn't ever hang in Windows like it does in WSL.

I suspect that Bunny.net itself should be able to handle a fairly substantial number of parallel connections... that being said, I'm not intimately familiar with how WSL2 itself makes those connections and if there's any oddities there that could be contributing. I've had to use other weird workarounds for the WSL2 filesystem when running Docker containers for io intensive containers (eg. Mongodb), so it's certainly possible it's still a parallel connection (or filesystem) thing, but perhaps something unique to WSL2. 


**Windows 1.64.0 version**
```
rclone v1.64.0
- os/version: Microsoft Windows 11 Pro 22H2 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 10.0.22621.2715 (x86_64)
- os/type: windows
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.21.1
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: cmount
```

**Windows Log Snippet**
```
...initialization, connections, file checks...

```

---

```

> My apologies for the late reply. I was just reviewing GitHub notifications and found this unread message. I tried the 1.65.0-beta (5824 fix) and it does seem to create substantially fewer connections. **I only saw 20 created connections and 20 closed at the end and did not experience the aforementioned issue when running this in WSL.**

Thanks for testing.

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.65 
 
> The reason I have some hesitation is I've been using the native 1.64.0 Windows rclone binary with the same flags (`--transfers 20 --checkers 20`) and it is consistently creating a large number of connections –oftentimes closing upwards of 60+ connections by the end– but it doesn't ever hang in Windows like it does in WSL.

Hmm, that is interesting. I suspect this is an oddity of WSL networking rather than rclone - maybe rclone was overloading it somehow by making too many connections too quickly.

I'm going to assume that was the case and close this issue, but if you find out otherwise please let me know.

hi @ncw, We encountered a similar issue when using rclone copy to upload data from local to the remote via SFTP. rclone would get stuck and make no progress.
```
rclone copy /mnt/csi-data-aly/shared/public/trafficlight/data drs-drs-backend-sftp-vepfs-share-wr:/training-pfs-shanghai/share-wr/public/trafficlight/data --log-file /var/log/drs/drs-hengyu-vllm-miss-bags-v9-0926-volc-1_20250926_105158.log --checkers 95 --transfers 75 --log-level INFO --ignore-existing --sftp-chunk-size 64Ki --no-traverse --progress --stats=5s --include-from /deeproute/drs/drs-hengyu-vllm-miss-bags-v9-0926-volc-1_20250926_105158.174
```

rclone config
```
root@drs-250928-decision-humanlabel-5-0-3-1-l9vlk:/# cat /root/.config/rclone/rclone.conf
[drs-drs-backend-sftp-vepfs-share]
shell_type = unix
host = drs-vepfs.srv.deeproute.cn
user = root
key_pem = <pem>
port = 2222
type = sftp
md5sum_command = md5sum
sha1sum_command = sha1sum
```

the backtrace of `kill -QUIT <pid>` as belows.
[drs-hengyu-sync-tl-label-0922-volc-1_20250922_215422.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22581550/drs-hengyu-sync-tl-label-0922-volc-1_20250922_215422.log)

rclone version: `v1.70.0-beta.8791.9d464e8e9`

@microyahoo not sure that is the same problem. Your problem might have been fixed by 4fc4898287c73c166e09cafdf127bf6e3e382d98

Can you try to reproduce with [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) please and if you can still reproduce the problem then open a [new issue](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/new/choose) on Github - with all the details - thanks

hi @ncw, after three weeks of running, the stuck issue has not recurred. Thank you for your support.
